subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|i}}: a man with a painted or tattooed chest – original form of {{zh-l|*紋}}. In current form, tattoo has vanished, so simply an outline of a man (head, outstretched arms, legs, chest). Compare {{zh-l|*大}}, which has no chest.

subSections.title: Pronunciation 2
Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|もん}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=もん}} {{m|zh|文|tr=mjun||ornate; a kind of coin; language, literature, a letter, a character}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The {{m|en|design}} and {{m|en|crest}} senses are more often spelled {{m|ja|紋}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぶん}}
A later borrowing from {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=ぶん}}. Compare modern {{cog|nan|-}} reading ''bûn'', {{cog|hak|-}} ''vûn''.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ぶん}}

# {{lb|ja|grammar|sort=ふん'}} a [[sentence]]
# [[writing]], [[composition]]
# a [[design]] or [[pattern]] as [[decoration]]
# [[literature]], [[learning]], [[scholarship]]
# [[elegance]], [[refinement]] {{qualifier|especially of writing or wording}}
# a [[saying]], an [[aphorism]], a [[proverb]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|文案|ぶんあん}}: a [[copy]] (advertising), [[copywriter]] (advertising); [[secretary]]; official [[document]]
* {{ja-r|文意|ぶんい}}: (grammar) [[semantics]]
* {{ja-r|文化|ぶんか}}: [[culture]]; cultural
* {{ja-r|文官|ぶんかん}}: a [[civil servant]], a [[public official]]
* {{ja-r|文学|ぶんがく}}: [[literature]]
* {{ja-r|文芸|ぶんげい}}: [[art]] and [[culture]]
* {{ja-r|文言|ぶんげん}}: the [[phrasing]] or [[wording]] of a piece of [[writing]]; in Chinese contexts, the [[written]] style or [[register]] as opposed to the [[spoken]] style or [[register]]
* {{ja-r|文豪|ぶんごう}}: leading [[writer]], [[author]]
* {{ja-r|文才|ぶんさい}}: writing [[talent]]
* {{ja-r|文書|ぶんしょ}}: document; written record; letter; epistle
* {{ja-r|文章|ぶんしょう}}: (grammatical) sentence; writing; essay; composition; writing style; [[Fumiaki]] (a male [[given name]])
* {{ja-r|文人|ぶんじん}}: [[intellectual]]; [[Fumihito]] (a male [[given name]])
* {{ja-r|文責|ぶんせき}}: author's [[responsibility]] (for the contents of a document) 
* {{ja-r|文体|ぶんたい}}: writing style
* {{ja-r|文筆|ぶんぴつ}}: [[writing]], [[literary]] [[work]], [[literature]]
* {{ja-r|文法|ぶんぽう}}: [[grammar]]
* {{ja-r|文末|ぶんまつ}}: [[end]] of a [[document]]
* {{ja-r|文脈|ぶんみゃく}}: [[genre]]
* {{ja-r|文民|ぶんみん}}: [[civilian]]
* {{ja-r|文明|ぶんめい}}: [[civilization]]
* {{ja-r|文面|ぶんめん}}: [[content]] of a [[document]]
* {{ja-r|論文|ろんぶん}}: [[thesis]]
* {{ja-r|博%士 論文|はく%し ろんぶん}}: a Ph.D. thesis
* {{ja-r|礼文島|れぶんとう}}: {{w|Rebun Island}}
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
Noun
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あや}}
Uncertain. Appears in texts from the early {{w|Heian period}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|あや}}

# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|紋}}, {{m|ja|綾}}}}
## a [[pattern]], a [[design]], especially one with [[diagonally]] [[crossing]] lines
## a [[diagonal]] [[crossing]]
## a [[flowery]] [[expression]] or [[turn of phrase]]
## a [[plot]], a [[scheme]]
## a [[refrain]] or recurring [[phrase]] in a piece of [[music]]
## a [[harder]] [[vein]] or [[grain]] in a leaf or piece of wood or bamboo
## a [[stain]], a [[blemish]]
## a [[mediator]], a [[go-between]] {{qualifier|apparently from the way that a go-between can make the relationship more indirect and indistinct}}
## a small indistinct [[fluctuation]] in a trend line
# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|綾}}, {{m|ja|絢}}}}
## a kind of [[woven]] [[silk]] [[textile]] with a diagonally crossing pattern
## short for {{m|ja|綾織|tr=ayaori}}: a [[twill]] [[weave]]; someone who [[weave]]s [[twill]]
## short for {{m|ja|綾竹|tr=ayadake}}: in a [[loom]], a [[bamboo]] [[pole]] placed between the [[heddle]] and the [[back beam]] or [[platen]], used to improve the handling
## short for {{m|ja|綾取り|tr=ayatori}}: [[cat's cradle]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: For the second group of senses, the {{m|ja|綾}} spelling is more common.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Compounds
